column4: did you go to the grub manual? There's something about windows on a non-first hard disk.
please... could you listen to me for a sec? I believe I might have help for you.
i chechked it through (although very quickly since all the chatting here) and it seemed i could get some help there.
yes, I think it's just what you need, called disk swapping.
you basically tell windows that it is on the first hd, when in fact it is not.
in the grub config file, you put something like: grub> map (hd0) (hd1) and grub> map (hd1) (hd0) and kinda lie to windows ;). It's detailed in the grub manual.
YES YES YES! that's the help i was looking for.
i should probably make bunch of backups before doing anything this radical :-)
I don't know dangerous this procedure is, I just happened to remember this chapter and thought this might be what you need. But backups are always a good idea ;).
yes. that wont touch the data, but if i somehow dama... well the odds are 1%
friend of mine fucked up his harddrive though. he had to make script that scanned HD one bit at a time to check where was the starting point of his windows partition
I understand regardless, I'm very paranoid myself. I backed up everything when I installed Ubuntu in October, but of course everything went well ;)
